termsContent.service:
1. [Required] Terms of Service Agreement

These terms govern the use of all services ("Services") provided by NewsBalance ("Company"), defining the rights, obligations, and responsibilities of both the Company and the user.

Article 1 Purpose
These terms set forth detailed procedures and conditions for using the Services provided by the Company.

Article 2 Definitions
"Services" means any service provided by the Company through online or other electronic media.

Article 3 Posting and Amendment of Terms
1. The Company shall post these terms and any amendments to the terms in a manner that is easily accessible to users on the initial screen or a linked screen of the Services.
2. The Company may amend these terms for reasons such as changes in related laws or improvements to Services. The Company shall specify the effective date and reasons for the amendments and notify users accordingly.

Article 4 Provision and Change of Services
1. The Company provides the following types of Services: content provision, personalized recommendations, customer support, etc.
2. The Company may change the provided Services for operational or technical reasons but shall notify users in advance of such changes.

Article 5 Service Subscription
1. A user is deemed to have agreed to these terms by applying for membership to use the Services.
2. Subscription procedures include email verification, agreement to terms, and entering personal information.

Article 6 Obligations of Users
1. Users must not engage in any activities prohibited by these terms.
2. Users are responsible for managing their passwords and securing their information.

Article 7 Obligations of the Company
1. The Company shall not engage in any acts prohibited by laws and these terms.
2. The Company shall maintain the system so that users can use the Services stably.

Article 8 Restriction and Termination of Use
1. If a user violates these terms or disrupts the operation of Services, the Company may restrict usage or terminate the contract.

Article 9 Limitation of Liability
The Company is not responsible for Service interruptions caused by force majeure such as natural disasters or communication failures.

Article 10 Jurisdiction and Governing Law
These terms are governed by the laws of the Republic of Korea, and any disputes arising in relation to these terms shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the court where the Company's head office is located.

2. [Required] Agreement to Personal Data Collection & Use

NewsBalance collects and uses personal data as follows to provide smooth Services and manage membership.

1) Purpose of Collection & Use
‚Ä¢ Membership management: verify subscription intent, identify/authenticate users, provide member-only Services
‚Ä¢ Service provision: provide content, personalized Services, customer support
‚Ä¢ Transaction fulfillment: product delivery, payment processing, invoice issuance
‚Ä¢ Service improvement: statistical analysis, surveys

2) Collected Items
‚Ä¢ Mandatory: name, user ID, password, phone number, email
‚Ä¢ Optional: address, birthdate, gender

3) Retention & Use Period
‚Ä¢ Personal data is retained until membership withdrawal. After withdrawal, data is stored for 5 years in accordance with internal policies and relevant laws, then destroyed.

4) Outsourcing of Personal Data Processing
‚Ä¢ Outsourcers: payment gateways, delivery agencies, SMS/email service providers, etc.
‚Ä¢ Outsourced tasks: payment processing, delivery, notification message transmission, etc.
‚Ä¢ Outsourcing period: until the outsourcing contract ends.

5) Right to Refuse Consent & Disadvantages of Refusal
‚Ä¢ Users have the right to refuse consent to personal data collection/use.
‚Ä¢ However, refusal to consent to mandatory items will limit membership registration and Service usage.

6) Rights and Means of Exercise
‚Ä¢ Users may request access, correction, deletion, or suspension of processing of their personal data at any time.
‚Ä¢ Methods: via MyPage, in writing, email, or phone.

5. [Optional] Agreement to Use Location Data

3) Retention & Use Period: Retained until termination of Service usage, then destroyed immediately.
4) Third-Party Sharing & Outsourcing: Not shared with third parties, provided only to outsourced vendors for the intended purpose.
